text: The Center for Civil Liberties () is a Ukrainian human rights organization led by the Ukrainian lawyer Oleksandra Matviichuk. It was founded in 2007. It was created to pressure Ukraine's government to make the country more democratic. The organization was awarded the 2022 Nobel Peace Prize, with Ales Bialiatski and Russian organization Memorial. ==References== Category:Organizations based in Ukraine
title: Center for Civil Liberties (human rights organization)
